creditline: Gift of Edith and Norman Garmezy
description: view of fisherman in boat through opening in base of bridge; lower structure of bridge, timbers and posts in dark foreground; hills visible in distance
inscription:
Signature, Title and Inscription

see Signed; on verso, LRC, in pencil: [130 (circled)]; URC, in pencil: [DW18]
provenance: Edith and Norman Garmezy, of Edina, acquired the print from Catherine E. Burns, California, in 1999.
signed: below image, right, in pencil: [Frank Short]; LLC, in pencil: [H.155 / S.226 Span of Old Battersea]
text: Frank Short added sand to his aquatint ground to achieve a rougher, darker texture for the timbers of the Battersea railway bridge.  The result is a grim depiction of urban decay as relevant today as it was to Londoners a century ago.
title: A Span of Old Battersea Bridge
